result.rationale: This species has an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 8,471 km<sup>2</sup> and a known area of occupancy (AOO) of 24 km<sup>2</sup>. It is experiencing a continuing decline in its habitat as a result of illegal gold mining. However, there is insufficient information to count threat-based locations. Therefore, it is assessed as Near Threatened.
result.geographicrange: This species is only known from the Guiana Shield. It has been collected in the upper Caura River, in Bolívar state.
result.population: There are no data available to estimate a population size.
result.habitat: It inhabits small creeks with shallow, clear to black waters with leaf litter substrate within forests. The channels of these streams are usually covered by riparian vegetation (Ardila Rodríguez 2004).
result.threats: Its habitat is subject to deforestation and pollution because of illegal gold mining (Oliveira-Miranda et al. 2010). One illegal gold mine (Las Pavas) occurs in the species' distribution area (Sanchez 2015), affecting the species through habitat loss and degradation.
result.conservationmeasures: The species occurs within the newly created national park that encompasses the entire basin of the Caura River, but clearly there is a need for improved habitat protection at sites where it is known to occur.
result.usetrade: It is unknown whether this species is traded in the ornamental fish market or if it is part of the livelihoods of indigenous peoples.
